meanings.sent1: After drinking soda quickly, he began to eructate loudly.
meanings.sent2: It is impolite to eructate at the dinner table.
meanings.sent3: The baby seemed to eructate on command, much to the amusement of the family.
meanings.sent4: The old car engine sputtered and eructated smoke as it struggled to start.
meanings.sent5: The volcano seemed to eructate fire and ash into the sky, creating a spectacular sight.

meanings.definition: The act of belching or burping
meanings.sent1: His eructate after the meal was quite loud and surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that excessive eructate could be a sign of digestive issues.
meanings.sent3: The symphony of eructate from the audience during the quiet play was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The eructate of the old pipes in the house echoed through the walls.
meanings.sent5: The eructate of the whale echoed through the ocean, signaling its presence to others.
